articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 12 Palestinians in a dawn airstrike on Rafah in southern Gaza on Thursday and fighting raged in several other areas of the coastal enclave, Gaza medics said.
articles.title: Israeli airstrike on Rafah kills 12 Palestinians, Gaza medics say

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: If the jury deliberating in Donald Trump's criminal trial makes the historic decision to convict him, the judge overseeing the case will face a monumental choice: whether to sentence the 2024 Republican presidential candidate to time behind bars.
articles.title: For Trump's false records charges, prison is rare but not unprecedented

articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Bate Felix
articles.description: First results from South Africa's most competitive election since the end of apartheid were trickling in early on Thursday, after a late voting surge kept many polling stations open with snaking queues late into the night.
articles.title: South African election results trickle in after wide-open vote

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, John Davison, Emma Farge, Ali Sawafta
articles.description: The Israeli military has lifted a ban on the sale of food to Gaza from Israel and the occupied West Bank as its battlefield offensive chokes international aid, according to Palestinian officials, businessmen and international aid workers.
articles.title: Exclusive: Israel reopens Gaza food sales as Rafah raid chokes aid

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States boycotted a United Nations tribute to Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi on Thursday because it said he was "involved in numerous, horrific human rights abuses" and that the world body should instead stand with the people of Iran.
articles.title: US boycotts UN tribute to late Iran president

articles.author: Jessie Pang, James Pomfret
articles.description: Fourteen Hong Kong pro-democracy activists were found guilty and two were acquitted on Thursday in a landmark subversion trial that critics say could deal another blow to the city's rule of law and its reputation as a global financial hub.
articles.title: Fourteen Hong Kong democrats found guilty in landmark subversion trial

articles.author: Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Allies of the late Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny said on Thursday that members of Russian President Vladimir Putin's inner circle and wealthy oligarchs should be subjected to additional Western sanctions in order to punish Putin.
articles.title: Navalny allies urge sanctions on Putin allies over opposition leader's death

articles.author: Diego Oré, Carlos Carrillo
articles.description: As Mexicans head to the polls on Sunday to elect their next president and thousands of state and local posts, much of the country is suffering historic drought, intense heat, and occasional power blackouts.
articles.title: Suffering drought, heat, blackouts, Mexicans head to the polls

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Swedish security service SAPO said on Thursday that the Iranian government had been using criminal networks within Sweden to carry out violent acts against other states, groups, and individuals.
articles.title: Swedish security service says Iran uses criminal networks in Sweden

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Finland's parliament should reject proposed laws that would prevent migrants arriving across the long, forested border with Russia from seeking asylum, the Nordic country's non-discrimination ombudsman said on Thursday.
articles.title: Finland's proposed ban on asylum via Russia should be rejected, ombudsman says
